186020777.review:
Shut up next time: a review by Bernie.

SPOILERS AHEAD

Undertale doesn't need an introduction but the fandom is going to tell you every single spoiler before you even buy the game.

My experience with this game was ruined before I ever got to play it.
If anything Undertale is a great example of how a fandom can actually ruin a game for people who haven't played it yet.

Rewind the clocks back to 2015, Undertale drops and EXPLODES in popularity. 
You could not escape people talking about this game or Openly discussing MASSIVE SPOILERS.
Every social media platform had people giving this game attention and even if you tried to avoid it, you couldn't.
It was everywhere, Spoilers in fan art that everyone was drawing, spoiling the jokes and Spoiling the endings.
I understand passionate fan bases/fandoms loving something so much that they can't help themselves,
but they ruined mine and probably many others experiences by oversharing every single aspect of it.

Undertale as an experience for me felt like joining a survival crafting game server with your friends and your friends handed you everything, a full set of the best armor, a full set of the best weapons gadgets and gizmos and a vehicle to explore the wastelands with, taking your ability to do all of those things yourself and essentially ruining the game for you. You have all the best stuff, why keep playing? That's what it was like trying to play undertale for the first time for me.

 I knew about the multiple endings I knew that the genocide run was bad and people were straight up legitimately harassed online for doing that. I knew about the pacifist ending and how to even get all of them, I even knew about what happens if you start the genocide run by killing characters and then starting over resulting in the characters commenting about it without playing the game ONCE I knew everything and that was because the fandom couldn't and wouldn't shut up with their oversharing of literally every aspect of this. (This happened with Doki Doki Literature Club as well)

I was extremely poor and borderline homeless in 2015 in an extremely abusive household and COULD NOT afford to buy undertale much less was I able to pony up 9.99 at the time for the game (not anyone's fault just explaining my situation)
I never had a fair chance to enjoy undertale.

Fast Forward to 2019 and I'm doing much better, Either I bought a copy or it was gifted to me and I tried tried tried with all my might to play it but remembered every single spoiler and every single joke before it was ever told by the game itself. I think "okay i'll go for the pacifist run, it should be easy" so I started streaming the game on twitch for friends. Random strangers joined in and were trying desperately to SPOIL the game for me even then. it was 2019 surely the fandom had died down at that point and I could give the game a fair shake finally? but no. That fandom could not help itself and just had to be annoying and try to spoil everything because they wanted to make sure I'd do everything right. Eventually after beating Endive passively I miss ONE SINGULAR CUT SCENE. 

An honest mistake missing the cut scene after Endive because the game doesn't really encourage you to back track and doing it previously yielded no new dialogue from characters to talk to, (please note I may be wrong about what scene it was I missed and where it was this was along time ago) so naturally I kept going. 

I get all the way to the big bad guy at the end, ready to do what I need to do to passively beat him, and what happens? Nothing. I cannot beat him, he's not killing me, i'm dodging his attacks it's fine, i keep hitting the act button and doing the passive thing for 30 minutes straight i'm attempting to beat him passively and I cannot, because I missed a SINGULAR CUT SCENE by pure accident I could no longer beat the bad guy, No passive ending, No Genocide Run Ending, No middle of the road ending Nothing.
STUCK completely stuck after sinking something like 8 hours into the game to get to this moment and i'm stuck because i missed A SINGULAR CUT SCENE. I even attempt to back track to see if maybe I do need to kill some characters and gain some levels who knows? I was trying anything at that point only to find out i'm stuck and can't beat the game now. ( I had no help by this point and was too pissed off to ask for it and i'm sure no one was actually going to help me because no one ever does)

That was the final nail in the coffin for me when it came to Undertale and anything that Toby Fox creates in the future. 
If i have to forcefully empty my wallet to get ahead of a psycho fandom and play a game before it's spoiled on youtube and social media and anywhere else than I don't want to play it.
 I understand fandoms can't help themselves and i'm sure Toby Fox doesn't give a rats ass because he's literally a millionaire now, but it absolutely sucks to have something like Undertale ruined. 

I know and can see how special Undertale is and how funny it is and how much heart it has and how much it means to a-lot of people but unfortunately for me it will never ever be that way, It won't be special, it won't be amazing it won't be this meaningful heart felt game for me ever because an overzealous fandom couldn't keep their mouths shut about spoilers and ruined the game for me before I ever got the chance to play it. 

Next time remember that your passion for something can accidentally ruin an incredible game for others.

Shut up next time.

-Bernie.

185958556.review:
I can’t say enough good things about Undertale. It’s not just a game—it’s an experience that sticks with you long after you’ve played it. Developed by Toby Fox, this indie masterpiece takes you on a journey that’s emotional, funny, and deeply impactful in ways I didn’t think a game could be.  

Why I Loved It So Much  

1. Incredible Storytelling  
   From the moment you fall into the Underground, the game pulls you into its world with a story that’s full of surprises. It feels like every choice you make matters, and the characters react to you in ways that feel personal. You can play as a hero, a villain, or something in between, and the game doesn’t just judge you—it remembers.  

2. The Characters are Unforgettable  
   Every single character in *Undertale* is bursting with personality. Sans, with his lazy but clever attitude. Papyrus, with his endless enthusiasm and spaghetti obsession. Toriel, who feels like a caring parent from the start. Even the minor NPCs feel alive. I found myself wanting to know more about all of them, and by the end, I felt like they were my friends.  

3. Combat That Breaks the Rules  
   The combat is so unique. You don’t have to fight anyone—you can spare them, and every encounter becomes a puzzle where you learn about the characters and how to resolve conflicts peacefully. It’s both challenging and rewarding, especially when you choose the Pacifist route.  

4. Music That Hits You in the Feels  
   The soundtrack is incredible. Songs like “Megalovania,” “Undertale,” and “Hopes and Dreams” are iconic and carry so much emotion. The music perfectly matches every scene, whether it’s a quiet moment of reflection or an intense boss battle. I still listen to it outside the game because it’s that good.  

Final Thoughts 
Playing Undertale felt like discovering something truly special. It’s quirky, emotional, and full of heart. It’s the kind of game that makes you think about your actions and choices—not just in the game but in life.  

If you haven’t played it yet, I envy you because you still get to experience it for the first time. It’s one of those rare gems that only come around once in a generation, and for me, it’s an all-time favorite. Absolutely 10/10.

This is so fire

185947297.review:
A Masterpiece for the Ages: Why Undertale Is the Perfect Game

In the vast world of video games, some titles entertain, others captivate, but few leave an indelible mark on the hearts of players. Undertale, developed by Toby Fox and released in 2015, is one such masterpiece. It is more than just a game—it is an experience that feels alive, authentic, and profoundly moving. Undertale achieves what many big-budget productions fail to accomplish: it makes us laugh, cry, reflect, and marvel.

Through its simple presentation, clever humor, epic battle system, and unique storytelling, Undertale has revolutionized the gaming world. It stands as a testament to how art can thrive in simplicity and proves that stunning graphics or cutting-edge physics are not prerequisites for creating an unforgettable journey.

Simplicity That Redefines Excellence
At first glance, Undertale is unlike most modern games. Its minimalist pixel art style harkens back to the classics of the 80s and 90s. Yet, this simplicity is not a limitation—it is the game's greatest strength. The stripped-down aesthetic shifts the focus to what truly matters: the story, the characters, and the unparalleled interactivity that sets Undertale apart.

This intentional simplicity allows the game to construct a world that feels meaningful without being overshadowed by unnecessary visual distractions. Every scene, line of dialogue, and location is carefully crafted, making each moment significant. The simplicity leaves room for the player's imagination to fill the gaps, deepening immersion and engagement.

A World Bursting with Life
What makes Undertale truly come alive is its characters and the world Toby Fox has meticulously created. Rarely does a virtual world feel so vibrant, witty, and charming. Every NPC, every enemy, and every corner of the underground seems to tell its own story.

From Papyrus, the endearingly overzealous skeleton aspiring to be a hero, to Sans, whose dry humor and laid-back demeanor are unforgettable, every encounter leaves a lasting impression. Even seemingly minor characters, like the quirky Temmie or the flamboyant Mettaton, exude personality and charm that resonate long after the game is over.

The world itself feels organic and alive. As you journey through the underground, from the snow-covered streets of Snowdin to the bubbling lava fields of Hotland, you can sense the immense care that went into crafting every detail. This is a world that breathes, reacts, and evolves based on your decisions, making it one of the most interactive and immersive gaming experiences ever created.

Humor and Heart: A Masterful Balance
Undertale strikes a rare balance between lighthearted humor and profound emotional depth. The game is filled with laugh-out-loud moments that often come unexpectedly. Whether it’s the quirky interactions with enemies, the absurd scenarios you find yourself in, or the hilariously offbeat reactions of the characters, the humor is sharp, intelligent, and utterly delightful.

Yet, Undertale is far from being just a comedy. Beneath its humor lies an emotional core that carries significant weight. The decisions you make have real consequences, forcing you to reflect on your actions. Few games have so effectively illustrated the thin line between hero and villain and the importance of empathy and understanding.

A Revolutionary Battle System
The battle system in Undertale is another shining example of its brilliance. On the surface, it resembles a traditional RPG: you face enemies, gain experience points, and level up. But soon, you realize Undertale turns this system on its head.

The twist? Combat is optional. Instead of attacking your enemies, you can choose to understand them, communicate with them, and resolve conflicts peacefully. This mechanic adds a moral dimension to the game, elevating it far beyond standard RPG fare. Every choice—whether to fight or show mercy—has far-reaching consequences on the story and its ending.

The battles themselves are a creative blend of bullet-hell mechanics and interactive dialogue. Each enemy has unique attack patterns, often tied to their personality or backstory, making every encounter feel fresh and exciting. This individuality ensures the game never becomes repetitive and keeps players eagerly anticipating the next challenge.

Endless Replayability
One of Undertale's standout features is its immense replay value. Depending on how you play—whether you choose the Neutral route, the Pacifist route, or the darker Genocide route—the story changes dramatically. Each playthrough reveals new details, dialogues, and perspectives on the world and its characters.

This dynamic storytelling makes Undertale a game you’ll want to revisit time and time again. Every decision feels significant, and each playthrough offers a fresh and rewarding experience.

A Soundtrack for the Ages
No review of Undertale would be complete without mentioning its phenomenal music. Composed entirely by Toby Fox, the soundtrack is nothing short of extraordinary. From the serene melodies of "Snowdin Town" to the adrenaline-pumping intensity of "Megalovania" and the emotional depth of "His Theme," every track is a masterpiece in its own right.

The music is not just an accompaniment but an integral part of the experience. It enhances the atmosphere of every scene, conveys emotion, and stays with you long after you’ve put down the controller.

Why Undertale Is Perfect
In a world where games are often judged by their budgets and graphics, Undertale stands as a shining example of what truly matters: heart, creativity, and meaningful engagement. It proves that a small team—or in this case, a single developer—with a clear vision can create something that touches millions.

Its simple art style makes it accessible, its profound storytelling makes it unforgettable, and its humor makes it utterly lovable. Undertale feels more alive than most AAA productions because it was created with genuine passion and care.

Conclusion
Undertale is more than just a game—it is an experience everyone should have at least once. It combines humor, emotion, and innovation in a way that is unparalleled in the gaming world. Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or a newcomer, Undertale offers endless joy and a sense of vibrancy few games can match.

It is the perfect game, a true masterpiece that will endure for generations to come.

185861815.review:
Dopo oltre un anno da quando ho finalmente giocato Undertale, ancora faccio fatica a trovare le parole per descriverlo in modo appropriato. È senza dubbio uno dei migliori giochi indie mai creati ed un testamento sulle potenzialità narrative insite nel game design.

Si potrebbe parlare approfonditamente del gameplay e del sistema di combattimento, la cui struttura richiama un tipico gioco di ruolo ma la cui implementazione e messa in scena che sfocia nel bullet hell è del tutto atipica. Si potrebbe parlare di quanto bella sia la storia e di quanto ben scritti sia ognuno dei personaggi che popolano il Sottosuolo. Si potrebbe parlare della bellissima ed espressiva pixel art e della colonna sonora maestosa. Si potrebbe analizzare nel dettaglio le tre diverse run: neutral, pacifist e genocide.

Ma la realtà è che ciò che rimane impresso nel cuore e di cui viene voglia di parlare sono i momenti e le sensazioni fortissime che Undertale ha regalato. [Spoiler]Il primo impatto con Flowey. La dolcezza e l'amore materno di Toriel e i proiettili nella sua boss fight che evitano apposta la tua anima. La comicità di Papyrus e i primi avvertimenti di Sans (con conseguente paura per quel sentito dire sul personaggio). L'accoglienza di Snowdin. Il viaggio verso Asgore, attraverso le terre di Undyne, Alphys e Mettaton. Tsunderplane. L'amore di Alphys verso Undyne. Il giudizio di Sans. Execution Points (EXP) e Level of Violence (LOVE). Il crash improvviso, Photoshop Flowey e l'inizio di metanarrazione con il suo appropriarsi del tuo salvataggio. La determinazione nel fare una pacifist run e nell'avere sempre pietà dei mostri. L'affezionarsi ad ognuno di loro. Il laboratorio segreto di Alphys e la verità su Asriel. Il dolore nel ripercorrere la casa di Asgore e Toriel. "Despite everything, it's still you." e la sua coltellata al cuore. L'arrivo di Ariel. "Hopes and Dreams" in cuffia. L'amicizia tra Asriel e [strike]Chara[/strike] Jerry e la comprensione di chi è Jerry e chi è Frisk. Il letto di fiori gialli. Quell'alba così bella. Il gioco stesso che non vuole che tu faccia la genocide run. L'inconsapevole consapevolezza che facendola rovinerai la vita a quegli insiemi di pixel dotati di anima che ti sei tanto prodigato a portare in superficie perché potessero vivere una degna vita in pace. La FOMO che ti porta a ricominciare, sapendo di dover fare il contrario dell'ultima volta. I mostri selvatici sconfitti. "But nobody came"... La musica che non se ne va più via. La desolante e frustrante facilità con cui spazzi via tutto. La resilienza e la determinazione di Undyne che salva il bimbo e ti mette sorprendentemente in difficoltà. La desolante e frustrante facilità con cui spazzi via tutto. [strike]Chara[/strike] Jerry che sovrasta Frisk grazie alla determinazione di me giocatore. Il monologo incredibile di Flowey e la metanarrazione portata a livelli mai visti prima, con il parallelo tra la frustrazione di Flowey nell'avere il potere di resettare ogni possibile universo, non sapendo più cosa fare dopo aver fatto tutto il fattibile, e il giocatore che cerca di completare ogni aspetto opzionale di un gioco. Il giudizio di Toby Fox nei confronti dei giocatori che hanno deciso di non fare la genocide run, ma che comunque la stanno guardando su Internet. Sans. Sans. Sans. Sans. Sans. Il più debole tra i mostri, ma il più intelligente e una delle boss fight più belle di sempre. L'inarrestabile distruzione di Asgore e Flowey. L'arrivo di Chara. La cancellazione del mondo e la morte di tutto. Il senso di colpa e la consapevolezza che, anche un reset per cercare di fare ammenda con una nuova pacifist non servirà a nulla, perché ormai abbiamo assecondato Chara e non si può più tornare indietro.[/spoiler]

Bisogna solo ringraziare Toby Fox, perché con Undertale ha dato un contributo enorme all'industria videoludica. Non giocherò più Undertale, perché è uno di quei titoli che una volta giocati esauriscono a tutti gli effetti la loro funzione narrativa. Ma i ricordi e le emozioni rimarranno per sempre.

185842061.review: 在刚开始游玩时，会被路上充斥的愚蠢的双关语和弱智的解密内容惹恼，但在结尾却会被一种出乎意料的方式所震撼。《UNDERTALE》打破了传统RPG的条约束缚，颠覆了对于RPG游戏的理解，它有着强大的剧本、独特的游戏方式、无处不在的惊喜、发人深思的结局、动态的叙事方式、对于RPG的深度理解，无法从其它任何一款游戏中找到相同的体验。快餐化游戏越来越多，但《UNDERTALE》将会让难以忘怀。游戏的画面或许并不怎样，但它无疑是一件艺术品。

185765159.review:
"Undertale! O RPG onde você não precisa matar ninguém."
A própria sinopse do jogo demonstra o quão revolucionário e diferente esse jogo é.
Undertale sequer é um jogo; Undertale é uma experiência, e para muitos, a melhor experiência audiovisual que tiveram na vida. E eu sou uma dessas pessoas. Undertale, para mim, é um dos melhores jogos indies de todos os tempos. É incrível e inexplicável como esse jogo consegue ser tão bom e tantos aspectos; Undertale tem, possivelmente, uma das melhores trilhas sonoras da história dos videogames, Toby Fox é um verdadeiro artista e suas músicas no jogo conseguem transmitir os mais variados sentimentos; os visuais de Undertale são simples, mas cada pixel nesse jogo é muito bem colocado e feito com muito amor, os personagens tem aparências únicas e marcantes; as mecânicas do jogo são muito bem feitas, os puzzles são simples já que o foco de Undertale são seus diálogos (história) e sua gameplay (batalhas), batalhas essas que são únicas, com cada inimigo tendo seus ataques próprios níveis de dificuldade diferentes; a história é o ponto principal de Undertale, com o jogo tendo três rotas, divididas por Rota Neutra, Rota Pacífica e Rota Genocida, sendo minha preferida, a Rota Pacifista, por ser uma forma de jogar diferente e referente à sinopse, contendo muitas reações e momentos sentimentais, com um final digno de muitas lágrimas, também aprecio muito a Rota Genocída pela sua dificuldade e habilidades necessárias para completar.
Em suma, Undertale é perfeito para quem quer viver uma experiência única, com músicas marcantes, uma história que muda a sua forma de enxergar a vida e uma gameplay que se difere baseado na sua forma de jogar, além dos personagens que são marcantes e carismáticos.
Undertale é único, e todos têm direito de viver a experiência de jogar Undertale.
Recomendo que joguem todas as rotas.

"Apesar de tudo, ainda é você!"

185762755.review:
It's good, great even. Not really anything to say at this point that anyone hasn't utterly ripped out of the game added 5 paragraphs of analysis and shoved it into some commentary somewhere.

I never reviewed this but it was one of the first couple of games I got on steam. I loved my time with it and I love the game, but there's something to be said for having an experience that felt personal to you and extremely enjoyable, only for a culmination of fandom to supersede the media it spawned from. 

I love this game, and I don't think I'll ever take that back, but it's hard for me to really look at this game with anything but disdain when the social consciousness of fandom will be the first impression of the game in the modern age, in reality anyone trying this game for the first time will have to deal with that as a barrier, have to deal with it being borne of 2015 and convince anyone who hasn't played the game to play a game that hundreds of thousands of people love without feeling out of place as anyone does with any beloved piece of media that's been praised to death.

None of these are knocks, they're things to think about of what the game is. So keeping that all in mind, does that ultimately change whether someone should play this game or not?

Not really.

Unless you have been drenched in overly zealous fan works and culture around this piece of media, it shouldn't ruin any part of the experience going in if you've only had a brushing glance with it. While popularity and time do both keep people away from works, this isn't a game where a case can be made for not playing the game. It's still interesting compared to other games out there, indie rpg or not and it hasn't aged poorly in any way. It's still worth your time and money.

so I guess if you haven't played this game you should play it, but as it needs to be said, that doesn't mean you have to.

185751943.review: Originally, When I first heard of Undertale i was around 12-13, I had watched Jacksepticeye's play-through of the game, but could never buy it myself, I scoured that play-through over and over, enamored with the characters and the gripping story. I wished desperately that i could be a part of it in some way. Eventually I found a fun way to download the game on my phone, and so i did, a buggy experience sure, but one i was overjoyed to finally undergo. I was part of the Undertale community for a really long time, people often say its strange and sure, i wont deny it has its strange tenancies. But the cultural impact of Undertale and its world is so everlasting that people liked the game so much to the point that they wanted to be a part of it, to expand it in any way they could. I was one of those people. This old channel "Sans Comic TV" would upload dubs of various Undertale comics, and boy oh boy would i spend THOUSANDS of hours over the course of my life watching those old videos. AU'S Like Underverse, fan game projects. Undertale as a CONCEPT has shaped me into the very person I am today, without it, I would be very, very different. I mean this from the bottom of my Soul, you will Never, regret getting this game, it is an experience, that changed the course of my life. And I wouldn't have it any other way, i'd do it all over again if i could, i wouldn't change a thing. If you have 10$ to spare, please, PLEASE play this game. It is among the greatest of Gaming experiences ever.

Indie Hall of Fame Worthy

Im not a Bullet Hell enthusiast
Im not a walking simulator enjoyer
Im not a native English speaker 

But still the jokes hit, the story keeps you enagaged and the creativity is of the roof, not much more to say, playing 8hr or 16 if you want to do another playthrough for true ending is great.  Music and Pixel art are incredible for a small team venture and writting is again out od this world.

Certainly influenced a whole era of gaming and was a trail blazer for the indie world, still remember how much Undertale was talked about and it wasnt until today that i realised my 2015-16 fav yt videos had Undertale music, certainly the meme genre has made this game inmortal for its music and sound design, now i finally understand why Matt from Gametheorist gifted the Pope a copy of this game.

Please Play and Enjoy.

185720869.review: I did not think I would revisit this Undertale.  I bought this game 4 years ago to try it out, I wasn't very good at it and got frustrated after I couldn't figure out how to beat the two guard dogs.  Last summer, I played Deltarune Chapters 1 and 2, and I found them to be more approachable than Undertale.  I've been invested in the Deltarune fandom ever since and I finally decided to try Undertale again and actually beat it.  And that's exactly what I did.  And my God, this game's story is life-changing and got me choked up quite a few times.  The True-Pacifist ending is something to behold, it is such a powerful and heartfelt conclusion to this story.  So please, if you somehow haven't played Undertale, do it.

Eu estava com saudades desse jogo, então resolvi comprar de novo e finalmente zerar tudo (menos a rota genocida, porque não consigo matar meus amigos, tadinhos).

Mesmo depois de anos, o jogo continua incrível. Os gráficos têm um estilo único, os controles são simples, e a história é simplesmente fenomenal. Os personagens são tão amáveis que eu não consigo machucá-los.

A verdade é que eu me recuso a fazer a rota genocida para provar ao Flowey que eu nunca desistiria das minhas amizades, mesmo nos momentos mais difíceis.

Se você ainda não jogou, recomendo muito! Escolha seu caminho, faça amizades, mate monstros e, acima de tudo, divirta-se! Esse é um jogo que realmente vale a pena. <3

185665212.review:
This is a game I've heard about for years but was unsure about ever wanting to try it out or not. I mostly play a lot of farm simulators (though I've been expanding my horizons lately), so I wasn't sure if the game play was going to to appeal to me or not. However, it went on sale for $2 so I figured it was a low stakes way to try it out and see why it was so beloved as to become a cult classic.

I'll admit, I played about 10 minutes and put it down. I felt like the game would be too boring. (Un)Luckily, I got COVID and was stuck at home so I decided to try again. I soon realized that beyond the tutorial-esque beginning, was a really engaging game with a lot of humor. I'm glad I went in totally blind to the mechanics of the game, because the end felt like a punch to the gut. It made me immediately want to play again to try a different approach. my only complaint is my same complaint for ALL games with turn based combat- which is that I find that type of combat to be very repetitive. However, the combat itself still had enough humor and creativity to keep me engaged, and the rest of the gameplay outside of the turn-based combat more than made up for it. I would def recommend buying this game to try out at full price, it is surprising and unique and will have opportunities to play again and again

185631837.review:
ОСТОРОЖНО, СПОЙЛЕРЫ!!!!!





Итак, пройдя эту игру на все концовки, я готов поделится мнениями насчёт каждой из них и рассказать, как их получить.
Нейтрал: У большинства игроков эта была самая первая концовка, у всех нейтрал выглядел по разному, это зависело от того, какие действия делал игрок во время прохождения, но многие вещи у игроков были одинаковые: суд Санса, смерть Азгора, битва с Омега Флауи и победа над ним. В конце нам звонил Санс и рассказывал о судьбе подземелья.
Истинный пацифист: Как можно догадаться, чтобы получить эту концовку нужно побеждать врагов не летальными способами, будь то пощада или побег из битвы. Так же, нужно будет подружится с двумя монстрами: Папайрус и Андайн. Через какое-то время Андайн попросит перейдать письмо Альфис, что мы успешно делаем. После свидания с ней, нам позвонит Папайрус, и предложит посетить её лабораторию в которой мы находит записку, сделаной учёной, далее мы в ходим в помещение, которое Альфис нам предоставляла как уборную, на деле это оказывается вообще лифт, входим в него и спускаемся по нему и с этого момента начинается самое интересное. По лифту мы спускаемся в лабораторию, которая выглядит так, будто это место давно заброшено. На нашем пути будут вставать различные твари, именуемые "Амальгаметами", монстры, подверженные "решимости" в результате чего рассеялись и превратившиеся в нечто. В лаборатории есть записи, оставленные Альфис, в них в основном рассказывается о экспериментах с Амальгаметами. В ней также можно найти записи, в которых мы узнаем интересные подробности: Азгор и Ториэль были женаты, а также можно послушать диалоги между Азриэлем и человеком, причем Азриэль обращаеется к человеку по имени, которое мы вводили в самом начале игры, что поталкивает на определенные мысли. Выбираемся из лаборатории, идем к Азгору, но перед битвой последнего атакует Ториэль, поэтому битва не начинается, также к гг приходят другие его друзья, но в один момент всех их хватает Флауи, поглощает все души монстров в подземелье вместе с душами 6 людей, принимая свою истинную форму: "Азриэль Дримурр". В ходе сражения мы побеждаем Азриэля, который раскаивается в своих грехах и мы естественно его прощаем. также мы узнаем настоящее имя главного героя "Фриск". Азриэль использует свою оставшуюся мощь, и освобождает монстров из заточения под землёй...
В принципе, концовка мне очень понравилась, поскольку она наполнена множествами сюжетных поворотов и потому что она просто милая. Я считаю, что каждый обязан пройти эту концовку!
Геноцид: Полная противоположность Истинному пацифисту. Как можно догадаться, надо убивать всех возможных монстров на локации, причём на каждой локации есть определенное количество монствов, после убийства которых на локации перестанут появляться монстры. Так же после обнуления счетчика убийств первые два босса будут убиты с одного удара, что может создать иллюзии того, что геноцид намного легче, чем нейтрал или пацифист, и к тому же все головоломки будут решены. Это иллюзии разрушится после встречи с Андайн, которая после смертельного ранения превращатся в свою улучшенную версию: "Бессмертную Андайн", которая является вторым по сложности боссом в Андертеил. После нелегкого боя мы доходим до Зала суда, где нас будет ждать Санс - самый сложный босс в этой игре. После того, как мы пострадали доходим до Азгора и убиваем его. Далее его добивает Флауи, которого мы тоже убиваем. И после, перед нами встаёт ОН, первый упавший человек. Он представляется именем, которое мы вводили в самом начале игры и благодарит нас за его возрождение, после, он предлагает нам выбор: Стереть этот мир или оставить его существовать дальше, не зависи от выбора, он убивает нас и игра вылетает. При повторном заходе в игре ничего не будет, лишь вой ветра и бесконечная тьма...
В общем, если игра показалась вам слишком казуальной, попробуйте пройти её на эту концовку, поверьте, не разочаруетесь.
А на этом я с вами прощаюсь, удачи!

185586058.review:
Undertale is literally  just peak weirdness wrapped in a bundle of pure chaotic brilliance. It’s like, if you took an old-school RPG, throw it into a blender with a bunch of memes and sprinkle some really good Humour on top.
The Story is about a kid aka. You, who falls into the monster world. It’s not just about fighting; it’s about how you approach everything. You can go full pacifist, befriend monsters, or go full-on savage and destroy everyone. Your choices matter, like, a lot. 

The characters somehow manage to be both hilarious and heart-wrenching at the same time ( Sans my Babe)
Undertale does a lot with very little. It’s like, the more you get into it, the more you realize the game is not what you expect it to be. 
Can wait for Delatrune to drop!
10/10

185580615.review:
冲着高的吓人的评分入坑的，我不喜欢被攻略剧透，所以就当然没有走上和平线，因为在试过几次mercy无果后就只好大开杀戒了。

游戏的场景和情节还是让人非常有代入感，最让我起鸡皮疙瘩的就是从怪物世界回到了出发的房子，不禁让人想起V字仇杀队里女主经过牢狱之灾的折磨后发现监狱的一墙之外竟然是V的房间的桥段；后续一路不断遭遇聊天怪，跟我娓娓道来这个怪物王国曾经的历史，不得不说在很多人物和台词方面，作者把怪物塑造的非常真善美。

虽然在通关后看了雁老师的视频后才知道这个游戏在剧情方面有多神，但是如果从游戏性的角度来看，我是有点失望的，个人还是喜欢诸如前不久全成就的帕特里克的箱子，电脑主机手机各买一份的杀戮尖塔，或者是剧情和战斗系统都非常出色的只狼和法环。这种我需要一直敲键盘阅读大量文字的游戏，实在不是很适合我（正如前段时间硬着头皮通关的命运石之门一样），所以只能说以后还是先了解下游戏类型，不要盲目依赖评分吧，毕竟适合自己的才是最好的

언더테일은 단순히 게임이라기보다는 하나의 예술 작품처럼 느껴집니다.
게임이 제공하는 독창적인 스토리텔링과 개성 넘치는 캐릭터들은 플레이어를 처음부터 끝까지 몰입하게 만듭니다.

특히 전투 시스템이 독특합니다. 적과 싸우는 대신 대화하거나 행동으로 문제를 해결할 수 있다는 점은 이 게임만의 매력을 극대화합니다. 적과의 상호작용은 단순히 선택지가 아니라, 플레이어의 선택이 스토리와 결말에 직접적인 영향을 미칩니다.

픽셀 아트 스타일의 그래픽은 심플하지만, 게임의 정서와 분위기를 완벽히 전달합니다. 무엇보다도 사운드트랙은 게임의 감정을 증폭시키며, 'Megalovania' 같은 곡은 전설적인 명곡으로 손꼽힙니다.

언더테일은 유머와 감동, 그리고 깊은 철학적 메시지를 한데 녹여낸 특별한 경험입니다. 게임이 끝난 후에도 오랫동안 여운이 남는 걸작입니다. 모든 게이머들에게 강력히 추천합니다!
평점: 10/10 - 단순히 플레이하는 것이 아니라, 느끼고 기억하는 게임.

やはり神作。アンダーテールの1番大きな特徴は、古典的なRPGと高度なアクションバトルを両立している部分だと思う。ソウルとコマンドの汎用性が高すぎて高難易度アクションからネタ全振りのギャグまでこなせるんだから凄い。
ただプレイのしやすさ という面では不満を感じ、避けられないランダムエンカウント、装備 収集要素が少なさ、セーブデータが1つだけだから多ルートを同時に保存出来ないこと。楽しみにくさ を感じる場面が少しある。
次作(？)のDeltaruneの感想になるけど、そういった点は大幅に良くなっていると感じる。アイテム数が増加したりチーム行動によるアクティブなキャラクターの増加だったり戦略的にもRPG的にも、UndertaleとDeltaruneどっちが好きと聞かれると断然Deltarune。あとは残りのチャプターの完成の無事を祈る。

185516943.review:
Man, after playing this game, I can confidently say it's an unforgettable experience! I wish I could go back in time to play it for the first time, it's just THAT kind of game. It's got a lot of charm and simple visuals, bursting with humor and a thought provoking story, and one of the most incredible soundtracks I've ever heard.

The music is the soul of this game. Tracks like "It's Raining Somewhere Else", "Don't Give Up", "An Ending", "Hopes and Dreams", "Undertale", and even overworld tracks like "Another Medium", "CORE", and "Waterfall" are beautiful and perfectly capture the mood of every moment. Whether you're just walking around, fighting a difficult boss in the climax, or just having a quiet moment of reflection, this soundtrack elevates every scene to a level I cannot even describe.

Undertale is a one of a kind experience, no matter if you're just here for the story, the music or the gameplay, it is truly something worth experiencing. 10/10!
[i] (P.S The music alone is worth the price) [/i]

185507661.review:
五年前因为这款游戏，我来到了steam，从此走上了一条邪恶的不归路[spoiler]（不是）[/spoiler]
       花了一段时间通关之后，我被深深震撼了，在这之前我还是属于一个山猪没吃过细糠的状态，只玩一些被如今的我摒弃为“垃圾”的游戏。从Undertale开始，我开始逐渐了解一个更加广阔的游戏世界，接触了更多优秀的游戏[spoiler]以及更多史[/spoiler]
       扯远了，回到游戏本身，这个游戏绝对值得你花钱和时间去体验一次，虽然在如今已经是十年老游了，然而它的剧情放在如今仍然能起到震撼人心的作用：三条[spoiler]其实是四条，只不过伪善线和和平线除了结局不同外流程都一样[/spoiler]不同的剧情路线大大拓宽了剧情的广度，同时每一条线的剧情深度都不错，能够让你沉迷在这个所谓的地下世界中，并且乐此不疲地去深挖它的每一处细节。同时游戏玩法简单易上手，只不过面对精英怪确实需要多练。[spoiler]毕竟是个剧情游戏，玩法倒是其次[/spoiler]
       总而言之，就像读一本书一样，你花掉一点钱和时间，就能够收获你人生中一段难忘的记忆。传说之下，也许真的会成为互联网上的一段传说。

185446004.review:
Without spoiling too much about the story, I'd like to tell you about Undertale. Undertale is a small but heartfelt game with JRPG elements, humor, characters and morality-questioning situations. A game with so many positive reviews inevitably deserves a try. So what makes Undertale different from other games?

First of all, the game begins when a human falls in with the creatures that live underground. After a battle between humans and creatures, you soon realize that the creatures are imprisoned here and you set out to return home. On this road you will encounter friendly and hostile creatures. You can either fight and kill them or donate them. Whichever way you go, there are surprises, big and small, depending on your decisions during or at the end of the game. In short, there are several different endings. This is one of the factors that affect replayability. Also, even in these replays, the game can change. It can offer you different situations during the game.

You may think that you are in control of the game by making your own choices, but let me tell you this much; the game knows that you are playing the game and what you are doing. It's as if a rogue program has been written and you're presented with very strange situations. You know, like in Metal Gear Solid where Psycho Mantis can read the saved games on your memory card. It's absolutely awe-inspiring.

There is not much difficulty in the game mechanics. Leveling up, gaining experience, item exchanges, encountering invisible monsters while walking on the road and going into battle, etc., which we know from every JRPG. But don't expect a very deep infrastructure, of course. The battle mechanics are not only designed as attack/defense. When you attack, a small mini-game appears. You try to avoid the enemy's interventions on that small screen. Apart from the normal attack where you can defeat enemies, there are special situations for each of them. For example, you can talk to them, love them, insult them, and many more. Each enemy has a weak point, and sometimes you have to use various combinations to get around it. It's up to you to find that out.

Apart from these, there are also puzzles. However, they are not challenging at all, but rather entertaining. The game even makes fun of itself in this respect. There are references to other games and competitions. It is very mischievous in this respect.

As you can see from the graphics, it's a retro game. The music is the same way and I can say that it has the sweetest and most atmospheric music I've listened to in a long time. It's listenable even outside of the game. The dialogs are not voiced, but fonts suitable for each character are used and sound effects are used accordingly. Sometimes you can even think he is talking.

As a final word, I can say that it is a game that deserves its current price. It is a game that contains less than a JRPG and at the same time much more. You really get caught up in thinking about what's going to happen. In my opinion, as an indie game, it is a quality production that competes with the games of the year.

185428219.review:
SPOILER! - Ich bin nicht zufrieden, aber andere könnten es sein:

Ich habe nach 8,5 Stunden Spielzeit das Spiel beendet und das Gefühl gehabt, meine Zeit verschwendet zu haben.
Die Zeit, die ich mit dem Spiel hatte war an sich nicht schlecht. Die Charaktere sind lustig, die Story an sich interessant. Die Spielelemente sind wirklich etwas anderes. Es macht an sich wirklich Spaß.

Allerdings hat mich das Ende richtig genervt.
Wenn man etwas im Spiel tötet, wirkt sich das negativ auf die Geschichte aus.
Das Problem daran ist, dass diese Mechanik erst später wirklich klar wird.
Meine Freunde haben es mir gesagt. Allerdings erst nach den ersten Monstern, die ich getötet habe.
Dadurch habe ich erst nach dem ersten Boss aufgehört Monster zu töten und die "Talk" Mechanik mehr genutzt.
Es war für mich absolut nicht intuitiv, das diese Mechanik irgendetwas macht, da man, wenn man sie benutzt, nur kurze Texte bekommt wie: "he is amazed off you" oder was auch immer. Um den Kampf damit aber zu beenden, muss man diese Funktion mehrfach nutzen.
Dadurch, dass ich nur diese Textnachricht bekommen habe, hatte ich nicht das Gefühl, dass die "Talkt" -Aktion etwas bewirkt.. Wenn ich aber "Attack" nutze, habe ich einen direkten Fortschritt.
Somit nutze ich natürlich als Spieler, erstmal diese Funktion. 
Als Dank für diese schlechte Designeinführung bekommt man dann ein offenes Ende mit der Bitte "Spiel das Spiel nochmal ohne jemanden zu töten".

Hätte man beim ersten Versuch jemanden zu Töten durch einen Externen Charakter einen Hinweis bekommen, wäre es etwas anderes. Aber so wird man wie gesagt nach ~8 Stunden dafür bestraft.

Ich hab ehrlich gesagt somit keine Motivation, dass Spiel nochmal zu spielen. Was Schade ist, angesichts der vielen guten anderen Aspekte des Spiels. 
Zudem gibt es wohl viele verschiedene Abschlüsse und Storys, die man Freispielen kann.

185416791.review:
UNDERTALE! Hiç kimseyi yok etmene gerek olmayan RPG oyunu. Bu yukarıda zaten yazıyordu, değil mi?

Undertale 2015 yılında çıkmış indie bir RPG. Oyun, klasik RPG oyunlarına kıyasla biraz daha farklı işliyor. Saldırı, savunma ve şans gibi koşullarla değil de, sizin karşı tarafın saldırısından ne kadar kaçabileceğinize göre işleyen bir tur sistemi var. Sizin 4 seçeneğiniz var; SAVAŞ, EYLEM, EŞYA ve İNSAF. Undertale diğer oyunlardan farklı olarak size illa ki düşmanı öldürmenizi söylemiyor, hatta tam tersi - düşmanınızı barışçıl yolla yenmenizi istiyor. Tabii ki, bu seçim size kalmış.

Hikayeye gelince, spoiler vermeden kısa bir anlatım yapacağım. Undertale, kısa bir oynanış süresine (yaklaşık 8-10 saat) sahip olmasına rağmen oldukça geniş çaplı bir hikayeye sahip. Ve oyun atmosferi, diyalogları ve hikayenin parçalarını size başlangıçtan sona kadar yavaş yavaş sunmasıyla sizi kendine çekiyor. Şunu unutmayın ki oyunun ilk kısımları biraz sıkıcı olabilir; çünkü oralar rehber [i] (tutorial) [/i] amaçlı. Kesinlikle paranıza değer, oyunun topluluğu oldukça iyi (tabii ki kötü kitleleri de var, dikkatli olun!) ve hikayesi çok anlamlı. 10/10 tavsiye ederim, iyi günler! :)

185391450.review:
Undertale — это игра, как будто её разработала бабушка, объевшаяся газировки, вдохновленная снами под кислотой и котиками. Сюжет? Какой-то ребенок падает в дыру к монстрам-психам. Персонажи – скелет-стендапер, рыба-полицейский, плачущая коза и зловещий цветок. Бои — это уклонение от сердечек и попытки подружиться со всеми. Это игра, где логика умерла от смеха.

Плюсы:

Сюжет, ломающий мозг, и персонажи, которые сами не понимают, что творят.
Можно уворачиваться от сердечек и подружиться со всеми (даже со злобным цветком).
Минусы:

Моральные дилеммы, которые делают тебя плохим человеком (но смешным!).
Боссы, от которых хочется разбить клавиатуру и потом посмеяться.
Игра заставляет чувствовать, а кто это любит?
Слишком много коз и скелетов!

Идеально подходит, если:

Вы любите абсурд и сюр.
Хотите сломать мозг и пойти дальше.
Хотите подружиться со всеми (даже со злым цветком).
Не подходит, если:

Вам нужна логика.
Вы не хотите чувствовать.
Моя оценка: 10 из 10 скелетов-стендаперов, рекомендую!

I never knew the game as well as the fan-fandom itself. I know absolutely everything that is connected with the game, but I have never played the game itself. I even watched something on YouTube about the game itself. And then suddenly the opportunity to play the game turned on, to find out why I love all sorts of fan-fandoms about the game so much.

The game itself was too difficult for me, despite the fact that I know about half of the gameplay, especially the one I often played in other games. The plot... I don't know if it can be a little difficult to perceive, but again, because of my knowledge of the game itself, I easily perceived the plot, rather than the gameplay itself, which I never perceived normally.

Either way, the game is still worth the desire to continue growing and having everything possible that it can.

185276940.review:
Without a doubt in my SOUL, I am absolutely DETERMINED to truthfully say that UNDERTALE deserves all the recognition it deserves. This game has practically elevated its status and is highly praised as other legendary games like DOOM and FNaF. But this game is not about the gameplay or action or graphics, its about the emotions.

This is a game that makes you fall in love with fictional characters, characters that act almost like they're real being with REAL emotions and lives. It's a game where you need to bring the sensibility you have in the real world to another world where the monsters underground too feel emotions and do things like you and me. This is the game that even the Pope would look at a respect it for its showcase of the blessings of kindness and the sins of cruelty. 

This is not a game, this is an experience. One which calls you out and also makes you think, like actually think about who you are and what you're actions cause. 

This game is an actual MUST-BUY, no excuses. If you aren't brainrotted skibidi toilet sigma talk tuah kid who acts like ishowspeed who can't even sit still playing DDLC, if you still have a basic reading ability, you'll be able to witness this game in all its glory, from beginning till end.

Once again, I'm saying this game is a MUST-PLAY. If you own a Switch, Playstation, Xbox or a mobile phone, this game will seriously make you laugh, cry and smile from ear to ear.

If humanity were to cease to exist, I pray this game is the last thing remaining from us humans so other life knows how we felt as well as for them to live with a new look towards life.

185271838.review:
This game has a stellar reputation and so much love, which is amazing but also means the expectations are sky-high. After my first playthrough, though, I realized this game doesn’t just meet expectations—it shatters them. It’s an exceptional experience that flips our assumptions on their heads and cleverly ties gameplay mechanics into the story in ways I didn’t expect.

After finishing both the True Pacifist and Genocide runs, I chose to end the world—and the game respected that decision. Now, I can never play it again. (For now.)

Of course, as Flowey would probably smirk and remind me, I have the same power he does: I can always dive into the AppData folder, delete the save file, and reset everything like it never happened. And honestly? I’ll probably do it just to go on a date with Papyrus again.

185165670.review:
I like this game - the characters are impressive, music is good, puzzles tend to be easy but kind of interesting, battle (only played pacifist so only the dodging part) is a bit hard but not as hard as I expected (I'm not skilled, but I got pass all battles of true pacifist line, each with less than 5 try, though I won some battles, like the 6 souls flowy one, cluelessly, like I'm not sure why I'm not hit though I can't really dodge the attacks...) - and I would definitely recommend trying. 

But there is one thing: why am I judged? I mean, though I walked only the pacifist line I watched/learnt about other ways of play. I think it is weird to consider killing monsters an act of sin - I mean, if it's not due to the power of reviving from the last save, the main character would be killed dozens of times by the monsters, so what is wrong to fight back? I mean, he/she can revive shouldn't be the reason that killing he/she is fine, right? So Sans, if he knows the mc's many deaths, how can he judge he/she (except if mc deliberately find and kill monsters like the in genocide line) like it is such a wrongdoing? Maybe didn't understand something, but I feel that this part is a bit... deliberate. Like, I know the ideal of peace and love is good, but as an old saying goes, one should be strict with yourself and lenient with others, I feel a bit wordless of this judging thing.

185123945.review:
A Whimsical, Heartfelt, and Unforgettable Adventure

Undertale is a truly special game that defies expectations at every turn. It’s a quirky, emotional, and cleverly designed RPG that feels like a love letter to video games while simultaneously flipping every genre convention on its head. From its humor to its heartfelt storytelling, Undertale delivers an experience that’s as unique as it is unforgettable.

At first glance, the game looks simple with its retro-inspired visuals, but don’t let that fool you—Undertale is brimming with creativity and charm. The art style and music create a nostalgic atmosphere that complements the game’s tone perfectly. The soundtrack, in particular, is phenomenal, with memorable tracks that will stick with you long after the game ends.

What makes Undertale so special is its storytelling. You play as a child who has fallen into the Underground, a world filled with quirky monsters. But the game gives you a choice: you can fight or spare every creature you encounter. This mechanic is not just a gameplay feature—it’s central to the story and profoundly impacts how the game unfolds.

The characters are unforgettable. From the skeleton brothers, Sans and Papyrus, to the determined Undyne and the shy scientist Alphys, every character you meet is full of personality and depth. Even the smallest interactions feel meaningful, and the game’s humor shines through in every dialogue box. Yet, it’s not just a funny game—it’s also deeply emotional, exploring themes of kindness, determination, and the consequences of your choices.

Speaking of choices, the game’s multiple endings add incredible replay value. Whether you choose a pacifist route, a neutral path, or the darker genocide run, each decision feels significant and leads to a radically different experience. The game constantly subverts expectations, breaking the fourth wall and playing with traditional game mechanics in ways that surprise and delight.

While Undertale isn’t long, it makes every moment count. It’s a game that will make you laugh, break your heart, and leave you in awe of its ingenuity. Whether you’re a fan of classic RPGs or just looking for a one-of-a-kind gaming experience, Undertale is a must-play.

185118804.review:
What are you doing reading Undertale reviews in 2025?
Do you live under a rock? Is affordable that rock?

Anyway, If you have played or heard of Heartbound: you are half way in it. If not, let me summarize it for you.

This is an lasagna of mechanichs, trophes, and wall breaks that amounts to RGP-Maker style exploration and pseudo combat with a few other mechanics built on top of it such as one-stick shooting, puzzle-solving, dating-sim, and some more.
If I say pseudo combat is because the rpg side of things is a greatly diminished one that relies more on the juxtaposition of mechanics of other genres (some of them being one-offs) to spice up every combat. Which results on a system that hurts my brain the more I try to categorize or rationalize it. So, pseudo combat with a mish-mash of different mechanics, it amounts to a fun to play experience, and I'll leave at that.

The story is light-hearted and more interested in being interesting and fun than to amount to anything great with the exception of the 4th wall breaks, which tackles meta topics that I won't spoil to you if you are genuinely reading this review in an informative way. But is worth to note that it encourages multiple playthroughs, and that I recomend to try a full pacificst rute first, and killing everything as your last.

The music is a special standout, Toby really knows how to heighten the emotions of the player and support its story moments to have them get to you. It doesn't have any special stinckers and the music ranges from good to excellent.

I know that the game's code could qualify as Italian cuisine, but the game doesn't jitter, breaks, nor tries to kill my PC, so you can rest assured that you aren't buying some bug-infested rainforest.

On top of all the previous, Undertale is part of the game zeitgeist at this point, worth checking out 10 years later both for its relevance and for its overall quality, it's well worth it's price, short and memorable. If you really like it, check out Deltarune, the lattest proyect of the author, and have a nice day; it's really beautiful outside.

"Undertale" — это игра, которая даже меня смогла удивить.
Кажется, что она простая, но стоит углубиться — и ты понимаешь: перед тобой настоящий шедевр, как моя техника 'Безграничность'. 😏

Каждый персонаж здесь — как драгоценный камень. Санс? Легенда! Торьель? Милота! Папирус? Король шуток! Даже Flowey оказался сложнее, чем я думал. (Но победить его? Для меня не проблема, ха!)

Музыка? Потрясающая! Геймплей? Инновационный! История? Заставила даже такого, как я, задуматься. А финал? Решай сам: пощада или сила?

10/10. "Undertale" — это как бы взглянуть на мир с моего уровня: всё кажется простым, но на самом деле всё куда глубже. Играть обязательно! Даже если ты не носишь повязку. 😉

P.S. Санс, если бы мы сразились, кто кого? Хотя нет, знаю ответ. 😂"

Acho que cada um deve experimentar a surpresa da história desse jogo, além das suas batalhas e personagens incríveis, aprecie com carinho. Absolute Determinação.

185059103.review:
O primeiro elogio que tenho que fazer é ao humor do jogo. Esse jogo é engraçado, as piadas estão simplesmente em todos os lugares, nos personagens, no cenário, em tudo, então não se esqueça de sair interagindo com tudo. O jogo me arrancou boas risadas e "pfffs". Outro elogio é o quanto ele me surpreendeu, aconteceram muitas coisas que eu não estava planejando, inclusive o final que eu fiz, e que eu amei muito *-* Eu adorei o quanto o jogo brincou com o seu formato, não vou comentar muito para não dar spoilers, mas esses momentos também foram surpreendentes e muito divertidos. 

As músicas são lindas, os gráficos são simples e muito fofinhos, o mundo construído também. Foi um prazer explorar cada canto, interagir com todos os monstros, conversar com npcs e saber as suas histórias de vida (que são muito engraçadas). É muito legal que cada monstro tenha uma forma "especial" de ataque e de interação - e por isso também é legal que tenhamos a opção de não atacá-los - e os créditos do jogo só me fizeram ainda mais feliz com essas particularidades dos monstros.  

Eu adorei todos os personagens, até mesmo aqueles que me irritaram MUITO ou os que me bateram MILHARES de vezes e colocaram minha determinação à prova. Foi difícil, mas muito satisfatório me despedir deles no final. Especialmente o Papyrus :D

É um jogo muito divertido de jogar, não é fácil, mas é possível terminar mesmo que você seja iniciante com jogos (como eu), é muito fofo, é lindo e a história é muito interessante, então não cansei em momento algum da narrativa. Recomendo bastante a experiência :)

185057787.review:
Quick Review: 

I'm gonna be honest with you, i am gonna recommend you to play Undertale but i, myself, have played it twice, in 2016 and now, and my feelings about it have changed drastically. Where i found intriguing and well made characters i now find dull dialogue and overused jokes that no longer land for me. Where i found well made and thoughout puzzles i now find them tedious and boring. And those graphics, are just no longer retro and nostalgic for me, but poorly made.
I specially started despising both Sans and Papyrus due to those exact same reasons. I know they are some peers favorite characters but i just can't stand them. I do like Toriel motherly bond and Flowey's demented attitude tho. Even tho he's a ghost i regreted slaying Napstablook cause i thought for a bit he might never come back and turns out, he's my favorite character from all the way back in 2016.
Just to be clear before we go on, nothing personal against the author of this game (Toby Fox), he did a great job and i hope Deltarune is successful too. Best wishes for him!
 
Onto the positives, the soundtrack is really good and it really captures every character and situation the game sets you in. The gameplay overall is not bad, its your above average RPG with a rather unique fighting system where you can attack (and slain your foe), talk and interact, use items or spare them, and, in all honesty, my problem with the puzzles in this game mostly boils down to them being too simple or too long, and that they grew old for me during my second playthrough.
There are some characters i genuinly liked, again Toriel and Napstablook are two examples but also Flowey, Undyne and a few others. 
Both times, i went for the neutral route cause i couldn't bring myself to slain Toriel. 

One thing is clear, this game was influential and still is to some degree but, in the end, i won't lie to you. Take this review as you like, i do recommend the game due to its popularity (specially back on release) but i would honestly never play it again after finishing my second playthrough. Its a game worth playing but maybe not everyone will like replaying it, specially if aiming for the pacifist and genocide routes.

Personal Rating: 6/10
Quick (Final) Score: 8/10

184963490.review:
The only downside of this game is that I didn’t play it earlier!

彡 What’s really cool is that everything depends on your actions. The way characters in the game treat you also depends on you, and that’s always awesome in games :3

彡 The combat system really won me over—it’s genuinely amazing! To spare someone, you don’t just press a button; you need to take an individual approach to each character before sparing them. That was a bit challenging for me since I enjoy the combat more 🥴

彡 Every character has their own personality and story, and that truly deserves praise!

彡 Of course, how could I not mention the soundtracks! It’s hard to resist tapping your foot to the beat while fighting yet another boss 😋

彡 Visually, everything looks simple, but that’s part of its charm. It somehow gives the game its unique vibe.

彡 It’s a bit sad that there’s no running mechanic, like in Deltarune, but that’s easy to overlook 😗

I’m glad this game has a wholesome fandom that’s still around 😛

184947439.review:
Excellent Sound Design: The music and sound effects are among the strongest aspects of the game. Each track is memorable and perfectly suited to the game's quirky yet emotional atmosphere.
Unique Gameplay: The mix of bullet-hell mechanics and RPG elements is refreshing, offering a choice-driven experience where you can fight or show mercy.
Engaging Story: The narrative strikes a balance between humor, emotional depth, and mystery. The characters feel alive, each with a distinct personality that adds richness to the world.
Charming Visuals: Simple yet effective pixel art contributes to the game's indie charm.

Undertale is a standout indie title that deserves its acclaim. Its combination of memorable music, clever gameplay, and emotional storytelling creates an unforgettable experience.

Rating 6/10

-- Neutral/True Pacifist Review --

After playing the whole pacifist route, I'm glad this is worth spending on. I loved the characters here like Asriel, PAPYRUS, sans, Undyne, Alphys, Toriel, Asgore, and many more that can't even be here.
The whole date with PAPYRUS, Undyne, and Alphys, along with the true lab, shaped how it would affect the future outcomes of this game.

In short, I loved this ending overall as you don't need to get stronger by killing monsters but rather befriend and spare them, although it doesn't make you stronger but your will is as you continue towards the goal but i think its the same for other routes.

184907527.review:
Eu não consigo dizer o quanto eu amo e continuo a amar esse jogo. Eu joguei praticamente todas as rotas dele numa versão traduzida e pirateada, mas agora voltar apenas pra dar um pouco do meu dinheiro pra nosso querido Toby Fox e jogar esse jogo de verdade, mais uma vez.

Não sou um fã extremamente velho, conheci ele no pico da sua popularidade (antes da pandemia pra frente) e mesmo assim sinto que já faço parte de uma família imensa e que nunca acaba. -- Esse jogo é simplesmente a pura genialidade encarnada, enriquecendo o gênero RPG.

Depois de UNDERTALE, todo o padrão de outros jogos do mesmo tipo aumentou. Por causa que essa experiência não é só mecanicamente interessante, mais ela valoriza os personagens ao invéz de números na sua tela. -- Em UNDERTALE maior do que upar, farmar e ficar matando é literalmente "os amigos que fizemos no caminho"

Caso você de alguma forma não sabe muito sobre UNDERTALE (quase impossível se estiver aqui), não pesquise sobre, não leia muitos comentários. Só jogue o bendito jogo, pois ele vai fazer 10 ANOS nesse 2025 e muita coisa ta solta sobre ele por ai.

Muito, muito obrigado Toby Fox.

184858389.review: I’ve beaten this game around 5 times across different consoles and systems and it definitely holds a spot as one of the most unique and best gaming experiences one can have. The story and lore is good while also being surprisingly dark and grim at times. This game carries a lot of depth and meaning with its cast of characters that work together very well. It offers a combat system that isn’t what you’re usually used to and presents you with the freedom of making choices that heavily affect the course of the entire story and ending. A lot of thought and effort was poured into this creation and I can’t recommend it enough to anyone who wants to play something short but meaningful and enjoyable with some very difficult battles depending on which path you take. 9/10

Эту удивительно странную игру либо заслуженно боготворят, либо так же заслужено закидывают помидорами. Это и не удивительно смотря на большой его фандом. Но она по своему уникальная, добрая, душещипательная сказка как для взрослых, так и для детей.

Плюсы: Разнообразные пасхалки и секреты, Уникальная боевая система, Три концовки(Я про основные Пацифист,Нейтрал,Геноцид), Оригинальный и непревзойденный саундтрек, Реиграбельность, Шикарный сюжет, Неожиданно меняющийся геймплей, Нелинейность, Хороший Юмор, Разрушение четвёртой стены.

Минусы: После прохождения чувствуешь тоску и отчаянное желание вернуться, хочется еще больше уровней или ожидание продолжения, моральное истощение после прохождения геноцид концовки, и битв с финальными боссами.

Надеюсь Deltarune скоро выйдет ;3

184769438.review:
!!!!SPOILERS!!!!
!!!!SPOILERS!!!!
!!!!SPOILERS!!!!
!!!!SPOILERS!!!!
So, for Christmas, a friend gave me Undertale, which I had heard of but not played.  I knew a few things but not that much—mainly that there were different paths based on whom you decided to kill or spare.

Knowing what small spoilers I did, I thought about how I wanted to play the game, and decided to try not to let my knowledge influence me.  It came to me very quickly that I would play as follows: kill only those characters I found it absolutely necessary to kill and do my absolute best to spare everyone else.

 

TORIEL

The first monster I killed was this psycho kidnapper who imprisoned me in her home and decided to make me her child against my will; then, when I tried to escape, repeatedly dragged me back before violently attacking me.  Aside from the fact of kidnapping and wrongful imprisonment, it became clear to me that the only way I’d ever be safe from her was to defeat her.

After that, I didn’t kill any monsters.  I went way out of my way to be merciful and spare them.  The only time I slipped up was once monster that attacked me.  I tried to spare it, but it refused, so I hit back . . . and hit way harder than I expected, since I didn’t fully understand the fight mechanics.  It died by accident.  A pity, but since it had attacked me first and I’d done my best to spare it, I wasn’t too broken up.

 

UNDYNE

The next monster I killed was this psycho stalker who followed me halfway across the world, repeatedly attempting to murder me.  I offered to spare her, to talk with her, anything—and she refused.  She screamed at me again and again that she was going to murder me and use my soul to open a portal to the human world, where she would murder all humans.  (And she dared call me a murderer!)  Se refused to back down, but I wasn't about to let her murder not only me but all humans.  I therefore fought back and I killed her.*

(*The game went all sad-music and then silence, as if I should be sorry for what I’d done; as if I’d been ruthless.  You know, because it was so wrong of me to prevent the monster who’d hunted me across the world from murdering all of humanity. . .)

There were three more encounters, over the course of the game, in which monsters attacked me and I couldn’t figure out how to save them, and who died while I was trying to get them to accept mercy or at least let me run away.  One of these encounters was the royal guards, so there were two of them.  My overall kill count was now up to six: four by accident, in defending myself, and two on purpose, out of reasonable necessity.

 

ASGORE

I then encountered the king, the one who had ordered everyone in his land to murder me in order to further his plans of genocide—for which plan he had already murdered six children.  To quote the king’s exact dialogue: “I said that I would destroy any human that came here.  I would use their souls to become godlike… Then, I would destroy humanity...”

(**The wiki says he plans “to kill seven humans and use their SOULs to break the barrier that traps everyone Underground. However, he is not evil or malicious” . . . Did whoever write the second sentence bother to read the first?)

I wished to accuse him of his crimes, of the deaths of the children and of the deaths of his own citizens (who had only died because he'd ordered them to murder me.  And . . . the game wouldn’t let me accuse him.  Instead, it made me listen to this child-murdering genocide-plotter give a long whiny speech about how it wasn’t his fault he murdered children.  He didn't want to do it; he didn't like it.  He just had to, y'see?

You are king.  You are king.  How dare you not want to dirty your own hands.  I guess it’s easy to order murder when you don’t have to do it yourself!  But it is your responsibility.  You evil murderer, how dare you!

Then the king attacked me, and I defeated him but didn't yet kill him.  As he lay wounded, he gave another whiny speech about how, really, he wasn’t a bad guy; he just murdered all those people because he wanted to give his people hope, but now doing that was too much bother (how tiresome child-murder and genocide had become!) and all he wanted was to go have a nicer life, so how about I just do what I like and leave him alone?  

How unbelievably selfish, capricious, and evil can you get?  But beyond that: what would happen if I did leave, and left you in charge, you murderer?  Of all the monsters I have met, it is you above all who deserve the name “monster”!  

And so, rather than let the king continue to do what he pleased, I killed him, determined to take his place as king: to rule the monsters as they should be ruled, to protect them without resorting to the evil methods of my predecessor.***  And without taking the monsters to the land of the humans, where their peaceful society would have been shattered into bloodshed.  Maybe someday, in small pieces, when the time was right.  But for now, when the monster society was peaceful and the king's prejudice strong and it had been established the monsters would easily be wiped out?  No.  I would bring about a fruitful society where we were.

(***But did the game allow this?  No, it crashed, made me fight a flower, and then had my character leave for the world of the humans, saying a robot was now king.  But that was not my choice.  My choice was not to leave.  My choice was to take responsibility and act as a king should act.)

 

I AM FRUSTRATED.

The story of the game accuses me of being a murderer and has all sorts of sad music for the actual murderers when they die.  It says—you must be a pacifist (but everyone else can be a murderer) or you’re just the worst!

Ultimately . . . this game, which is full of seeming choice, did not give me the choices I wanted: to accuse the king and to rule in his place.  (And yes, I’d have been allowed to rule in that society.  Apparently, any old person can rule it, based on how some endings allow a dog to rule, a celebrity robot to rule, the unknown Papyrus to rule, etc.)  

To survive with mercy, with sense, and with strength, to take what was broken and work with it, to take responsibility . . . these things, the game would not allow.

What a pity.  What a waste. And yet I stand by my character's decisions, every one of them, as reasonable and just and necessary.  

I would have been the king they needed.  And whatever the game says, I declare this my ending.

... And clearly, I got invested enough.  Recommended!

184761866.review:
A text-heavy, deliberately janky, bullet hell friend-em-up, a social worker RPG made by a young adult for young adults.

This one bounced right off of me. I went in blind, only vaguely aware that the game was being called a 'must-play' experience with an enormous cultural impact, and that it could be easily spoiled if anyone told me ANYTHING about it. I wish someone had just used a little discretion and explained the basics, I would have known not to waste my time here.

What I wish I'd been told initially: This is a tribute to the earliest days of jRPGs. It presents itself as such, but with the catch of being able to opt out of killing the characters you encounter. Aside from the quirky 'awkward' teen writing style, this is the primary feature of this game that sets it apart from its inspirations. You'll only achieve the 'true' ending by adhering to absolute pacifism. Instead of dice rolls, you exchange blows with your opponents in a tiny bullet hell minigame that varies with the situation. Instead of casting spells or abilities, you can try to talk your way out of combat.  The puzzles come straight out of mobile brain-trainer apps and are constantly interrupted by random enemy encounters. More characters left alive means more plot and exposition, and a deepening of the character development for all involved (except the protagonist). You have to try and find the 'humanity' in every 'monster' you encounter. This usually presents itself as some form of neuro-divergence which everyone serves up as their primary feature. You will encounter germophobes, the depressed, narcissists, histrionics, comedians, and sufferers of all other manner of psychological maladaptations. These characters are two dimensional in presentation AND in the sense that their disabilities define them entirely. This may have been a fresh and exciting take in the 2010s, but in the current year, I find it exhausting. Also the controls, engine, and graphics are awful on purpose.

I couldn't feel any connection to the player character, the comedy style, the dialogue, the subversion of ancient rpg tropes, or the forced emotional traps set by the pacifist opportunities presented in the game. On a positive note, -some- of the music was quite nice, and there was a clear effort to push boundaries and break from tradition. I could REALLY feel the inexperience and youth of the developer showing through in every aspect. He clearly has an incredible eye for tropes, has played and understood a variety of classic games, a real talent for writing, and he understood what a 'certain audience' was looking for, I just wasn't part of the targeted majority on this one. It's a shame, I really wanted to see how he'd progressed as a developer in the decade since; and it appears that the success of this title killed his career. 

Some titles that explored the same concepts but were more fulfilling for me personally, aka games that ruined undertale for me:
Spiritfarer. Emotional heavyweight with character development and silky gameplay as the primary focus.
Lakeview Cabin series. Tribute to the old days of pixel gaming and horror tropes, with insane amounts of environmental storytelling and lore, with almost no dialogue needed.
The Forgotten City. Choices Matter, replayability, incredible character depth, lots of scrolls-like game tropes subverted, explores actual themes of pacifism, philosophy, trauma and hopelessness. 
What Remains of Edith Finch. Exploration of trauma and disabilities, character depth, narrative and environmental storytelling par excellence.

184728393.review:
I can't recall how many time's I've played through Undertale but it's enough to know that I would highly recommend the game to anyone interested.

Undertale delivers more emotional depth, humour, fun and replay value than almost 90% of AAA video games released currently and it does it with a development team you could fit in a phone box.

The characters are exceptionally well realised, the art style is simple but charming, the story is surprisingly complex (especially on repeated playthroughs) and the gameplay loop is easy to pick up but almost always fresh as you encounter new areas and enemies. 

Alongside all of these great attributes Undertale as a game poses some of the most well-thought-out and intriguing questions to the player about the nature of video games and morality while still maintaining its integrity as a video game itself. 

It's so rare to find something that was clearly made with so much love and attention to detail that you can't help but love it too. Undertale is a 5 star experience all the way, buy this game and play it now!

184703269.review: It took me nearly 10 years to convince myself to properly play this game. In that time, my friends have grown up and long moved on from it, and I have missed the experience of getting to gush over it with them in its heyday. Somehow I managed to dodge youtube for years, and today I finally beat the game all the way through the True Pacifist ending unspoiled. Undertale is amazing, and I wish I could have enjoyed it while it was still relevant. Please never be so afraid of closing a door that you deny yourself the opportunity to experience something life changing.

184684113.review:
This is such a cute game, through and through! It's an entertaining little story about family, betrayal, community, love and loss. Its random generation allows you to have a completely different experience every time you play. While yes, the layouts hardly change by much, if at all, new encounters can be possible one play-through but completely absent several other plays! This provides the game with plenty of replay-ability, in addition to the game encouraging you to replay the game with polar opposite approaches! The game has three primary endings, although you technically have a variety of endings for your neutral ending, and two opposite endings--depending on how you handle certain encounters.

  I highly recommend this endearing, and often times comedic yet heart-pulling story, and strongly encourage you replay it a second time for either of the alternate endings! They add so much more content and lore to the world!

184643104.review:
【剧透警告】

      好喜欢，这个游戏很多地方都让人感动。一开始没太在乎羊妈的话，以自己玩RPG的经验大开杀戒，中途总感觉有些不对，一直到雪镇，看到有人在询问刚才那些人哪儿去了心里钝钝的，后来知道可以怎么饶恕小怪时已经来不及了，看到鱼姐攻击越来越慢真的好难受。（我居然没发现问答部分宅龙的提示），当看到杉斯说出EXP和LV的意思后真的感觉浑身像触电一样，没错后来有时候行动一两次还没试出黄名我还是会随手砍怪，当我习惯伤害他人后，这件事对我而言就越来越寻常。最后我也饶恕了小花，后来去网上搜索选择攻击会怎么样，发现只需要一下小花就会被杀死，攻击别人很简单，仁慈却需要不断的打磨自己，责问自己的内心，接受很多试探，多好的表达啊。很高兴玩出了属于自己的结局，MTT篡位了hhh。
      和平线也通关啦，真的真的真的很喜欢鱼，和鱼约会我哈哈大笑，本想着已经知道了小花不会杀死羊爸了，心里有了预期，没想到结局的表现还是大大超过了我的想象，SAVE的时候看到朋友们的名字我真的忍不住流泪，BGM也是超大杯！还有个特别喜欢的地方，最后大家站在一起等待来到地面，我和宅龙闲聊，她说自己会像个人生输家那样继续当个阿宅，那里也哭了，是啊我的人生不完美，但是甘愿当个人生输家也挺好的。
      遇到这款游戏真的太好啦，2024我的TOP1.

184633710.review:
剧情：别出心裁，代入感非常强。
配乐：一般是为了配合情节发展，起到烘托气氛、铺垫情感和辅助叙述的作用。在《undertale》中，它的音乐不仅配合剧情发展同画面主导故事叙述，而且还从听觉上制造了超越视觉的效果。
游戏性：从未玩过如此类型的“战斗系统”，解谜虽说不出彩但也很好玩，还有各种结局和彩蛋，非常耐玩。
总结：万中无一的绝世佳作

184628592.review: 惊为天人，我一时竟只蹦出这个词来。转眼间这已经是一个十年的老游戏了。几年前在手机上用虚拟手柄边玩边查攻略的我仿佛仍在那张床上，但我却已不再年少。如今我有了自己的电脑，终于有机会宴请一下童年的自己。又一次来到新家，又一次听见熟悉的undertale，又一次看到属于全体人类和怪物的太阳，我却还是像个孩子一样又笑又哭。或许这就是toby给我们留下的惊喜吧，在游戏中，明知攻略的我对繁琐的选择感到厌烦，此刻曾经的我就悄悄在桌子下面傻笑。千年太短，未来定长。感谢你，陌生人，愿意听我在此倾诉，愿你在新的一年里也仍能保持属于你的决心，去属于你的“地底世界”去找到属于你的传说

184584499.review: Undertale is, in my humble opinion, the epitome of a perfect indie game. If I could make a single criticism of it, it would be perhaps the simplistic gameplay. But in truth, when you allow yourself to be a part of the story, the world, that ceases to matter. The joy of this game doesn't come from admiring your own stats or skill - it comes from laughing at the way you talked your way out of an encounter with a dog whose neck stretches into space, or crying over the slowly revealed story of a family torn apart by grief and guilt. I have never shed so many tears over a game. And I won't even begin to discuss the soundtrack- But I don't have to, the entire gaming community is with me on the fact that Undertale's OST is complete brilliance. If I could give one piece of advice to anyone playing this game it would be this: Forget everything you know about gaming. Play this game as if you are truly experiencing it. Play it with open eyes and an open heart. It will change your entire perspective on video games, if you let it.
